Name: Bobby Burns (Crockett's recipe)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of skewered Luxardo Maraschino Cherry .
Review: Scotch and vermouth with added depth of flavour courtesy of absinthe and orange bitters.
History: Recipe adapted from Albert Stevens Crockett's 1931 Old Waldorf-Astoria Bar Days where the cocktail is listed as "Robert Burns" accompanied by the following notation, " It may have been named after the celebrated Scotsman. Chances are, however, that it was christened in honour of a cigar salesman, who 'bought' in the Old Bar [at the Waldorf-Astoria]. " Robert Burns was a brand of cigars and the name of a cigar shop close to the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel. It could be that the hotel sold these cigars, and the shop's owner was such a good patron of the bar that a cocktail was named in his honour. See Bobby Burns cocktail history for the whole story.
Nutrition: One serving of Bobby Burns (Crockett's recipe) contains 165 calories
